media:group.media:title: How Boxer Engines Work (In 60 Seconds)
media:group.media:description:
Boxer engines are popular engines used in Subaru and Porsche cars, such as the Subaru WRX STi and Porsche 911 GT3. The engines have cylinders that lay flat (not to be confused with a 180 degree V engine), giving them a low center of gravity, and due to the design, they have low engine vibration. These unique engine designs are currently only used by Porsche, Subaru, and Toyota in production cars.
